transition.title: Transition package – 6 sessions for relocation or role change
transition.subtitle: A contained space to think clearly, recalibrate, and move through change without burning out.
who: Professionals relocating to the UK or between cities, unsure how to rebuild work and life rhythms.
People moving into a new role or sector and wanting a grounded, values-aligned plan.
Those navigating mixed feelings: excitement, grief, pressure to 'have it all sorted'.
topics: Clarifying what “a good move” means in your context, not social media’s.
Mapping financial, family, visa and wellbeing constraints into real options.
Setting boundaries with employers, family, or yourself around pace and expectations.
Designing low-risk experiments instead of one-shot, high-pressure decisions.
how: Light check-ins between sessions when useful (email or message, not extra sessions).
Optional short reflection notes after sessions to help you track learning and decisions.
Language: English or Mandarin; we stay attentive to culture, class, migration and care roles.
approach: ICF-aligned, non-directive coaching: you set the agenda; we bring presence, questions and structure.
We work with the whole person: practical steps, emotions, identity, relationships and rest.
We slow things down enough for you to hear your own thinking, then move into specific next steps.
not: Not therapy, counselling, legal, financial or immigration advice.
Not a guarantee that relocation or a new role will feel perfect.
Not performance coaching for someone else’s agenda without your consent.
transition.cta: If this sounds close to what you need, use the contact form and note 'Transition package'. We will arrange a short call to check fit before you decide.
transition.ctaButton: Contact us about the Transition package

returning.title: Returning to work – 6 sessions after a break
returning.subtitle: Thoughtful support for stepping back into paid work without abandoning what matters.
who: Parents or carers re-entering the workforce.
Those returning after illness, burnout, study or a career pause.
People feeling guilt, fear of judgment, or uncertainty about 'what I can still do'.
topics: Reframing your story so your break becomes context, not a secret or a flaw.
Clarifying what kinds of work, teams and rhythms are now realistic and respectful.
Preparing for conversations with employers, partners and family.
Building self-trust: starting small, testing assumptions, adjusting without shame.
how: Optional CV / LinkedIn review inside the coaching frame (you stay in charge).
Between-session prompts to notice energy, capacity and boundaries in daily life.
approach: Gentle but honest: we name constraints without collapsing into them.
We treat care work, unpaid labour and health realities as real, not side notes.
We invite reflection instead of pressure; you choose commitments that fit.
not: Not a 'fix your gap in three hacks' package.
Not clinical support for active mental health crises.
returning.cta: Mention 'Returning to work' in the contact form. We will co-check expectations, capacity and timing before starting.
returning.ctaButton: Ask about the Returning to work package

newToUk.title: New to the UK – context-aware coaching
newToUk.subtitle: Space to decode norms, choose your stance, and navigate work and life without losing yourself.
who: Newcomers balancing immigration rules, job search, and family expectations.
People navigating language, race, class, or accent bias at work.
Those feeling 'grateful but small', stuck between survival mode and wanting more.
topics: Understanding how UK workplace norms might meet your values and limits.
Choosing how much to adapt, when to push back, and what to ignore.
Exploring realistic job search strategies that protect dignity and health.
Naming grief, anger or loneliness without pathologising your reaction.
how: We can work bilingually (English / Mandarin) where helpful.
We signpost to other services (legal, mental health, community) when appropriate—never as an upsell.
approach: We hold immigration and structural constraints in view without blaming you.
We stay curious about culture, faith, class, gender, language and power.
You define what 'settling' or 'belonging' should mean for you now.
not: Not immigration advice or visa consultancy.
newToUk.cta: If this resonates, select 'New to the UK' in the contact form and briefly share your context.
newToUk.ctaButton: Start a New to the UK enquiry

checkIn.title: Steady check-ins – 1 or 3 sessions
checkIn.subtitle: For when you don’t need a big package, just a clear, ethical space to think.
who: Clients who completed a package and want light-touch follow-up.
Leaders, carers or professionals who occasionally need a neutral sounding board.
People facing one decision and wanting space to think it through.
topics: A specific conversation, change, or decision you want to untangle.
Re-aligning with your values when work or life has drifted.
Checking your boundaries, capacity and next experiments.
how: Single 55–60 minute session, or a bundle of 3.
Online, focused, with a clear agreed aim at the start.
You can book ad-hoc, subject to availability.
approach: Same ICF-aligned stance: you lead, we partner.
We go straight to what matters; no scripted funnel.
You leave with 1–3 specific next steps or questions to keep exploring.
not: Not a substitute for ongoing therapeutic or medical care.
Not performance management disguised as support.
checkIn.cta: Use the contact form, choose 'Check-in', and note whether you prefer 1 or 3 sessions. We will confirm fit and practical details.
